title: Rollback to stable Binance-only frontend and remove CoinGecko references

requirements.summary: Remove CoinGecko from frontend runtime and restore Binance-only (WebSocket + REST fallback) with existing synthetic fallbacks.
acceptanceCriteria: The codebase contains no runtime calls to CoinGecko endpoints and no CoinGecko-specific services/hooks are used anywhere in the frontend.
Any CoinGecko-related configuration variables are removed from the app runtime/config and are not required to run or build the project.
All dashboards/modules load successfully and continue to display live market data using Binance-only sources (WebSocket + REST fallback) and existing synthetic data behavior where applicable.
No user-facing UI text mentions CoinGecko; any user-facing text introduced/updated by this change is in English.

file_operations.description: Audit and remove any CoinGecko-related imports, code paths, or fallbacks (services/hooks/utilities) and ensure all enrich/fallback logic uses only Binance live data via useBinanceData plus existing synthetic behaviors.
Confirm Binance-only behavior by removing any CoinGecko fallback branches (if present) and ensuring the data pipeline is strictly Binance WebSocket with REST polling fallback.
Ensure all market-data base URLs and REST fallback logic are Binance-only, and remove any CoinGecko-related constants/configuration (if present).
Delete CoinGecko service module (if present) to ensure no CoinGecko runtime calls remain.
Delete any CoinGecko-specific hook (if present) to prevent CoinGecko usage in the frontend.
Delete any CoinGecko utility module (if present) used for URL building, symbol mapping, or fallback logic.
Create a single Binance-only market data provider facade used by the app to centralize and constrain provider usage to Binance (no provider switching).

Remove any CoinGecko-dependent UI behavior (if present) and ensure flow rendering continues using backend data + Binance-only live/synthetic fallback. If any CoinGecko text exists, remove it and ensure replacements are in English.

Remove any CoinGecko-dependent UI behavior (if present) and ensure projections continue using backend data and Binance-only synthetic projections. If any CoinGecko text exists, remove it and ensure replacements are in English.

Remove any CoinGecko-dependent UI behavior (if present) and ensure zones continue using backend data + Binance-only synthetic fallback. If any CoinGecko text exists, remove it and ensure replacements are in English.

requirements.summary: Make the Binance-only rollback the default stable baseline with CoinGecko fully removed (no hidden switches or dead code).
acceptanceCriteria: There is no optional/hidden switch that re-enables CoinGecko; the application operates as Binance-only by default.
The application builds successfully without any CoinGecko-related modules, imports, or config.

file_operations.description: Remove CoinGecko-related frontend dependencies and scripts (if present) so the frontend builds without any CoinGecko modules.
Remove any CoinGecko-related environment variables from the frontend runtime configuration (if present).
Remove any CoinGecko-related environment variable documentation (if present) so no CoinGecko config is implied or required.
Ensure no provider-selection or feature-flag logic references CoinGecko (if present), and confirm the default behavior is Binance-only.
Lock the provider facade to Binance-only exports and remove/avoid any provider toggle or fallback-to-CoinGecko option to prevent dead/hidden code paths.
